alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 11 at 4:09AM PST until January 13 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 3000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches possible with up to two feet above 5,000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northern Trinity County including hwy 3 north Weaverville and Hwy 299 at Buckhorn Summit. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels are expected to be significantly lower north and east of Hayfork, but there is still a lot of uncertainty on how low. It is possible they will stay below 2,000 feet and weaverville will see several inches of snow.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
